Articles.Content: Ive been looking at the gameplay for ksp 2 and ive noticed that every time a lander is entering the atmosphere of kerbin or jool or what not they dont have any effects whats that all about is there no drag?

I don't recall any re-entry images/videos except one KSP1/KSP2 image that showed re-entry heating compared between the two games. The only 3 things I can say about that image are:

  1. It for sure showed re-entry effects. They looked a lot better than the KSP1 effects.
  2. I am not at all sure it wasn't a trolling image.
  3. I have no idea how to find it now to post it.

18 minutes ago, jaf said:

Ive been looking at the gameplay for ksp 2 and ive noticed that every time a lander is entering the atmosphere of kerbin or jool or what not they dont have any effects whats that all about is there no drag?

It was mentioned in one or two videos that the reentry system was turned off, and the reentry effects were also turned off. They do exist, the build the content creators played just didn't have them turned on.

14 minutes ago, GoldForest said:

It was mentioned in one or two videos that the reentry system was turned off, and the reentry effects were also turned off. They do exist, the build the content creators played just didn't have them turned on. 

ohh ok thank you

Some context from the pre-release notes thread: "Re-entry heating and thermal systems are offline - you'll have a brief window here at the beginning of Early Access during which you can re-enter any atmosphere without a heat shield. We’re still buttoning down our heat transfer, ablation, and occlusion systems. Vapor cone visual effects are also still in-progress."

Time to slam into Eve's atmosphere at 20 km/s.
